intro: Aporosa subcaudata, commonly known as the narrow-tailed aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Aporosa subcaudata is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
